title: Senior DevSecOps Engineer
description:
**Location:** Gothenburg, Sweden

**Work Location:** Onsite

**Preference:** Female Candidates

**Job Description:** DevSecOps Engineer

As a DevSecOps in the Platform team, you will contribute to the continuous improvement work and plan forward. You are expected to have knowledge sharing in your DNA and to take an active part in self-upskilling. You have a customer driven mindset and come up with new ideas to support the business by testing and learning.We are looking for someone with a developer mindset.

You also need to have a good understanding of the Azure DevSecOps Security best practices.

* Openshift or Kubernetes
* Docker containers
* ARGO CD
* Redhat Enterprise
* Linux
* Azure Cloud or AWS
* Azure DevOps
* Terraform
* Ansible
* Splunk
* Bash
* .NET ​

**Email ID - bhawna.gugnani@swediumglobal.com**

Job Type: Full-time

title: Scrum master
description:
Om företaget
  
JP IT-Konsult i Stockholm AB är ett växande konsultbolag som samarbetar med etablerade kunder inom finans, försäkring, e-handel och andra områden där digital transformation står i fokus. Vi strävar efter att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar i en dynamisk miljö, präglad av korta beslutsvägar och nära samarbete. Nu söker vi en erfaren Scrum Master som vill hjälpa våra kunder att nå framgång genom agila arbetsmetoder och kontinuerlig förbättring.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
  

**I rollen som Scrum Master kommer du att:**  

Facilitera de dagliga mötena (daily stand-ups), sprintplaneringar, retrospektiv och sprint reviews.
  
Ta bort hinder (impediments) och stötta teamet i att leverera värde kontinuerligt.
  
Samverka nära med produktägare, utvecklare, testare och andra intressenter för att skapa tydliga och realistiska mål.
  
Uppmuntra och driva en kultur av ständiga förbättringar, lärande och transparens.
  
Vara ambassadör för agila principer och värderingar, samt anpassa processerna efter teamets och verksamhetens behov.
  
  

Kravprofil
  
Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta som Scrum Master eller i en liknande agil ledarroll.
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda och coacha team inom agila ramverk (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe).
  
Förmåga att snabbt sätta sig in i nya tekniska och organisatoriska miljöer.
  
God kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
  
Erfarenhet av verktyg som Jira, Azure DevOps eller motsvarande planeringsverktyg.
  
  

Meriterande
  
Certifieringar såsom CSM, PSM, SAFe Scrum Master eller motsvarande.
  
Vana vid att arbeta i komplexa organisationer, gärna inom finans, försäkring eller e-handel.
  
Förståelse för DevOps-kultur och kontinuerlig integration/leverans.
  
Erfarenhet av att leda distribuerade eller internationella team.
  
  

Om dig
  
Du är en lyhörd, engagerad och resultatinriktad person som motiveras av att skapa förutsättningar för andra att lyckas. Som konsult är du flexibel och har lätt för att bygga förtroende. Du vågar utmana teamet när det behövs och strävar efter att hela tiden hitta förbättringsmöjligheter. Du drivs av att se människor och organisationer växa genom agila principer och metoder.
  
Ansökan
  
Skicka ditt CV i Word-format (docx) och gärna ett personligt brev till info@jpitkonsult.se senast 2025-01-22. Vi vill ha ditt CV i Word-format för att vid behov kunna justera det innan det presenteras för kund. Urval sker löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan.
  
Välkommen att växa med oss på JP IT-Konsult i Stockholm AB!

title: Application Security Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about security and empowering others? As an Application Security Engineer, you’ll play a key role in embedding security into our CI/CD pipelines and engineering practices from the very beginning. With a focus on collaboration and coaching, you’ll help 160+ squads elevate their culture and practices around application security, ensuring we build secure solutions that our customers trust.
  
About the role
  
In this role, you’ll design and implement application security strategies, conduct assessments, and partner with development teams to integrate security seamlessly into the software development lifecycle. By providing guidance, training, and actionable insights, you’ll help foster a culture where security becomes second nature.
  
  

**Your responsibilities will include:**  

Conducting security assessments, including threat modeling, code reviews, and vulnerability assessments.
  
Collaborating with development teams to integrate security into the software development lifecycle (SDLC).
  
Identifying, analyzing, and remediating security vulnerabilities in applications.
  
Providing training and guidance to development teams on secure coding practices.
  
Staying informed about the latest security trends, vulnerabilities, and compliance standards.
  
Participating in incident response and security investigations as needed.
  
  

We offer
  
In the same way that we place high demands on you, we expect you to place high demands on us. Here's what you can look forward to:
  
An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome.
  
Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics.
  
A possibility of a hybrid workplace.
  
A health-promoting workplace with wellness allowances and sports activities.
  
Great insurance benefits.
  
Lunch benefit.
  
High pension saving.
  
  

About the team
  
As part of the DevOps Center of Excellence, you’ll join a team of passionate professionals spreading hands-on knowledge across our 160+ squads. Together, we’re embedding security into every facet of development, ensuring robust, secure applications for our customers.
  
Who are you?
  
You are a dedicated security professional with a knack for collaboration and education. Your technical skills and proactive mindset make you an invaluable partner to development teams.
  
  

**You also have:**  

A bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field.
  
Proven experience in application security, penetration testing, or related roles.
  
Strong understanding of web application architectures, technologies, and security best practices.
  
Familiarity with security tools such as SAST, DAST, and IAST.
  
Proficiency in programming languages like Java, Python, or JavaScript.
  
Knowledge of compliance standards (e.g., DORA, OWASP, PCI-DSS, GDPR) is a plus.
  
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative approach to teamwork.
  
  

Additional facts and the recruitment process
  
**Application deadline:** Screening and interviewing will start immediately.
  
**To apply:** Please attach your CV.
  
**Work location:** Stockholm.
  
**Start:** As per agreement.
  
For more information, contact Johan Wildros, Head of Devops Center of Excellence, at johan.wildros@if.se or +46 73 420 99 00
  
  

We look forward to your application!
  
Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.

title: Quality Assurance Automation Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about automation and driving quality in software? As a Quality Assurance Automation Engineer, you will champion the automation of quality processes, mentoring teams and shaping a culture that prioritizes excellence. Your efforts will ensure reliable, high-quality software across our 160+ squads.
  
About the role
  
In this role, you will design and execute automated testing strategies, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and improve QA tools and frameworks. By identifying opportunities for improvement, you will help us elevate our DevOps culture and engineering practices.
  
  

**Your responsibilities will include:**  

Collaborating with teams to create comprehensive test plans based on project requirements.
  
Identifying competence gaps, engineering practices, and opportunities for improvement to advance our DevOps maturity.
  
Enhancing tools and frameworks to boost testing efficiency and effectiveness.
  
Staying informed on the latest trends and best practices in automation testing.
  
  

We offer
  
In the same way that we place high demands on you, we expect you to place high demands on us. Here's what you can look forward to:
  
An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome.
  
Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics.
  
A possibility of a hybrid workplace.
  
A health-promoting workplace with wellness allowances and sports activities.
  
Great insurance benefits.
  
Lunch benefit.
  
High pension savings.
  
  

About the team
  
As part of the DevOps Center of Excellence, you’ll join a team of passionate professionals spreading hands-on knowledge across our 160+ squads. Together, we’re embedding security into every facet of development, ensuring robust, secure applications for our customers.
  
Who are you?
  
You are a skilled QA automation expert with a proactive mindset and a passion for collaboration. Your technical expertise and dedication to quality set you apart.
  
  

**﻿You also have:**  

Proven experience in software quality assurance and automation testing.
  
Proficiency in programming languages like Java, Python, or C#.
  
Familiarity with automation tools such as Selenium, Cypress, or similar frameworks.
  
Knowledge of Azure DevOps.
  
Strong understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies.
  
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  
Exceptional communication skills and a collaborative approach to teamwork.
  
  

Additional facts and the recruitment process
  
**Application deadline:** Screening and interviewing will start immediately.
  
**To apply:** Please attach your CV.
  
**Work location:** Stockholm.
  
**Start:** As per agreement.
  
For more information, contact Johan Wildros, Head of Devops Center of Excellence, at johan.wildros@if.se or +46 73 420 99 00
  
  

We look forward to your application!
  
Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.

title: Senior Devops Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about empowering developers with smooth deployment processes? As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you’ll be at the heart of driving efficiency, reliability, and scalability for our systems. By implementing best practices and bridging the gap between development and operations, you’ll ensure seamless deployment processes and infrastructure that’s secure, scalable, and cutting-edge.
  
About the role
  
In this role, you’ll enhance our platform's performance by implementing robust CI/CD pipelines and automating infrastructure provisioning. Your expertise will shape our cloud infrastructure and foster collaboration across development and operations teams, ensuring the highest level of reliability and security.
  
  

**Your responsibilities will include:**  

Designing, building, and maintaining scalable CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps.
  
Automating deployment processes using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, Bicep, or ARM templates.
  
Monitoring system performance and proactively troubleshooting issues.
  
Enhancing cloud infrastructure across AWS, Azure, or GCP, with a focus on Azure.
  
Mentoring junior DevOps engineers and fostering a culture of excellence.
  
Collaborating with engineering teams to adopt DevOps tools and practices.
  
Ensuring security best practices are applied throughout the development and deployment cycle.
  
Troubleshooting and resolving issues in CI/CD pipelines.
  
  

We offer
  
In the same way that we place high demands on you, we expect you to place high demands on us. Here's what you can look forward to:
  
An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome.
  
Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics.
  
A possibility of a hybrid workplace.
  
A health-promoting workplace with wellness allowances and sports activities.
  
Great insurance benefits.
  
Lunch benefit.
  
High pension savings.
  
  

About the team
  
At If, culture is key, and our DevOps Center of Excellence Team embodies it every day. We’re spreading both DevOps culture and competence across our 160+ squads with a hands-on approach. Join us in shaping the future of operational excellence in the Nordics' leading insurance company.
  
Who are you?
  
You are passionate about solving complex challenges, and your technical skills are complemented by your ability to work collaboratively and proactively. You thrive in environments where you can mentor others and implement best practices.
  
  

**You also have:**  

5+ years of experience in a DevOps or similar role.
  
Proficiency in CI/CD tools such as Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI.
  
Expertise in containerization (e.g., Docker) and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
  
Strong knowledge of scripting languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
  
Experience implementing infrastructure-as-code solutions.
  
Familiarity with cloud architecture and services in AWS, Azure, or GCP (preferably Azure).
  
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
  
Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively in a team.
  
  

Additional facts and the recruitment process
  
**Application deadline:** Screening and interviewing will start immediately.
  
**To apply:** Please attach your CV.
  
**Work location:** Stockholm.
  
**Start:** As per agreement.
  
For more information, contact Johan Wildros, Head of Devops Center of Excellence, at johan.wildros@if.se or +46 73 420 99 00
  
  

We look forward to your application!
  
Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.

title: Stationsingenjör till Göteborgsområdet
description:
*Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? FRA söker nu en initiativtagande och problemlösande stationsingenjör till ett varierande jobb med ansvar för den lokala IT- och radiomiljön i Göteborgsområdet.* *Är du den vi söker kan vi erbjuda ett varierande arbete i en kunskapsintensiv verksamhet där du får vara med och göra skillnad varje dag. På FRA arbetar vi med unika uppgifter – för Sveriges säkerhet och integritet.*

**Om FRA**


Omvärlden är FRA:s arena. Vår uppgift som underrättelsetjänst är att skydda Sverige mot de allvarligaste hot som kan riktas mot ett samhälle – militära angrepp, terrorism och cyberattacker. Vi skyddar det viktigaste vi har – vår trygghet, vår demokrati och vårt sätt att leva. Genom vår kunskap om omvärlden kan vårt land förbereda sig och möta hoten i tid. Vi är experter på cyberområdet och signalspaning och en larmklocka för militära hot. Vi är också kärnan av det svenska cyberförsvaret och skyddar de viktigaste verksamheterna och den viktigaste infrastrukturen från angrepp. För att klara våra kärnuppdrag krävs avancerade tekniklösningar. Tillsammans har vi en unik uppgift, som vi löser med hjälp av vår kunskap och kompetens.


För din trygghet. För vår demokrati. Varje dag. Året om.

**Ditt uppdrag**


I rollen som stationsingenjör tillhör du avdelningen för teknik. Avdelningen har till uppgift att förse FRA med de tekniska system som behövs för verksamheten. Avdelningen utvecklar, förvaltar och driftsätter nya tekniska system samt sköter drift och underhåll av befintliga system. Tjänsten som stationsingenjör är bred och din vardag kommer vara väldigt varierande. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är framförallt att:

* Ansvara för underhåll och installation av hård-, och mjukvara
* Arbeta med installation av radio/telekommunikation och IT & mätteknik.
* Arbeta i, och implementera flera olika system

**Du kan**


Vi söker dig som har:

* Teknisk eftergymnasial utbildning eller motsvarande kunskaper förvärvade genom relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Kunskaper om nätverksmiljöer, AD, samt erfarenhet av arbete med switchar, routrar och brandväggar
* Erfarenhet av felsökning av IT-system
* Goda kunskaper inom IT och telekom
* B-körkort
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift

  

Vi ser det som meriterande om du har:

* Kunskaper inom Linux
* Kunskaper inom radio-, och antennteknik och elektronik
* Kunskap om Mätteknik
* Kännedom om begrepp som DevOps, Lean, Kanban och Scrum.
* Kunskaper inom systemadministration

  

Det är viktigt att du har ett stort tekniskt intresse då tjänsten förutsätter en allmän teknisk bredd. Det krävs att du har B-körkort då resor ingår i tjänsten.

**Du är**


Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper, och på sikt blir du den som är problemlösande och initiativtagande och på egen hand tar tag i olösta problem eller utmaningar. Du har fokus på kunden och en hög servicenivå där du visar genuint intresse för andra personers frågor och problem. Du som söker sätter gärna höga mål för dig själv och arbetar på tills resultat är uppnådda. Du har lätt för att anpassa dig efter förändrade omständigheter och är fortsatt positiv och kan fortsätta arbeta konstruktivt även vid mer tuffa situationer. Eftersom rollen kännetecknas av att du har mycket kontakt med verksamheten ser vi även att du har lätt för att samarbeta och ser vinsten av att dela med sig av information och erfarenheter för att tillsammans nå mål och resultat

**Vårt erbjudande**


På FRA är varje arbetsuppgift en del av något större. På ett eller annat sätt får du som medarbetare vara med och bidra till att skydda Sveriges integritet och oberoende i världen. Du är med och gör skillnad på riktigt, varje dag.


Våra medarbetare har hög kompetens, men vi kan alltid bli bättre. Därför är professionell utveckling en självklarhet för oss. Vi erbjuder möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Som nyanställd får du bredda din kompetens direkt med en omfattande introduktionsutbildning som ger dig en större förståelse för uppdraget och hjälper dig in i verksamheten. Som medarbetare får du också möjlighet att hitta rätt utbildningar inom ditt specialområde för att bli ännu bättre på det du brinner för.


Vi värdesätter god hälsa hos våra medarbetare och erbjuder bland annat friskvård under arbetstid. Andra förmåner som vi erbjuder är exempelvis gym på arbetsplatsen, gratis parkering och ledighet på klämdagar.


Hos oss blir du en av de bästa. På ditt sätt.

**Mer information**


Arbetsplatsen är belägen i Göteborgsområdet. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då anställning vid FRA innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för att få anställning är godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprövningen kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. title: Sr. DevOps Engineer
description:
**This is Worldline** 




 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




 At Worldline, delivering a fantastic payment experience that our customers love is what we burn for. Our cloud-native acquiring platform is processing billions of card transactions including authorization processing and clearing and settlement for our customers to trust. Currently, we are looking for a skilled product oriented DevOps engineer to team up with one of our empowered product DevOps teams.
 



  





**Day-to-Day Responsibilities​** 




 Our autonomous teams work with a lean product focused DevOps culture that continuously delivers true outcome, and if you build it, you run it! This means that you are responsible for:
 


* Active participation and contribution in all phases of the product lifecycle including discovery, delivery and operations.
* Delivering your team’s committed objectives, adapting to whatever is needed to reach the goal you and your team have committed yourselves to reach.
* Securing an outstanding qualitative service availability 24/7/365 and on-call duty is expected according to a rotating schedule.



  





 You love identifying the outcomes to be achieved together with your team, our customers, our internal users, other stakeholders and suppliers to deliver a truly outstanding acquiring processing experience for our customer and our business to love.
 



  





**What makes you stand out** 



* You have previous experience from the card-payment industry, preferably acquiring processing or other transaction intense industry.
* Are skilled in AWS and micro-services and serverless technologies.
* Are passionate about delivering a payment acquiring experience that brings value for our customers and our business.
* Highly collaborative, setting your team first while also successfully collaborating with others.
* A role model for your team and others by paying attention to commitment, accountability and the true outcome for yourself, your team, our customers and internal users.
* Are comfortable in a fast-moving and agile culture - handling many different stakeholders, prioritizations and fast decisions is not an issue for you.



  





**Who Are We Looking For** 




 People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. You also:
 


* Have confirmed experience in software development and coding in various languages including Java, Python, JS, and SQL etc.
* Background in micro-service, high availability and serverless software architecture and design running on AWS distributed over several availability zones and regions.
* As a result, we would like you also to have proficient knowledge in AWS cloud services including DynamoDB, Lambdas, ESC, RDS, Terraform, CloudFormation.
* Jenkins Pipeline and GIT, CI/CD, Release on Demand
* Docker
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, engineering or other meaningful field
* Deepened knowledge of software architecture and design including information security and experience from high-available API platforms is
* A deep understanding of software quality assurance principles
* Fluency in English and Swedish
* Valid working permit for Sweden (office location is Stockholm)



  





**Skills we’d like** 



* Experience from DevOps ways of working and lean culture
* Paying attention to commitment, accountability and result for yourself and for your team.
* Experience from developing secure and/or PCI-DSS certified solutions is considered an advantage
* Good communication and presentation abilities
* Challenging status quo
* Having a technical and curious mindset, continuously learning and sharing your knowledge with your peers and others.



  





**Perks & Benefits** 




 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
 


* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.



  





**Shape the evolution** 




 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
 



  





**Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com** 




  





**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: DevOps Engineer/Systemutvecklare
description:
*Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? FRA söker nu initiativtagande och drivna problemlösare för arbete med design och utveckling av vår IT-miljö. Är du den vi söker kan vi erbjuda ett varierande arbete i en kunskapsintensiv verksamhet där du får vara med och göra skillnad varje dag. På FRA arbetar vi med unika uppgifter – för Sveriges säkerhet och integritet.*
**Om FRA**
 Omvärlden är FRA:s arena. Vår uppgift som underrättelsetjänst är att skydda Sverige mot de allvarligaste hot som kan riktas mot ett samhälle – militära angrepp, terrorism och cyberattacker. Vi skyddar det viktigaste vi har – vår trygghet, vår demokrati och vårt sätt att leva. Genom vår kunskap om omvärlden kan vårt land förbereda sig och möta hoten i tid. Vi är experter på cyberområdet och signalspaning och en larmklocka för militära hot. Vi är också kärnan av det svenska cyberförsvaret och skyddar de viktigaste verksamheterna och den viktigaste infrastrukturen från angrepp. För att klara våra kärnuppdrag krävs avancerade tekniklösningar. Tillsammans har vi en unik uppgift, som vi löser med hjälp av vår kunskap och kompetens.
   

  

 För din trygghet. För vår demokrati. Varje dag. Året om.
   

  

**Ditt uppdrag**
 Som systemutvecklare i detta team hör du till avdelningen för teknik. Vi söker nu dig som vill vara med och utveckla nya verktyg och lösningar. I rollen kommer du att arbeta med delar som design, säkerhet, utveckling samt förvaltning. Då teamet ansvarar för utvecklingsstödjande komponenter och applikationer för främst Linux men även Windows är det en fördel om du har bakgrund inom dessa plattformar. Teamet kommer att ha ansvar för hela utvecklingsmiljön.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en innovativ IT-miljö där du får möjlighet att samarbeta med kunniga och erfarna kollegor. Vi arbetar agilt i sprintar tillsammans med andra team enligt SAFE-ramverket. Vi har också ett naturligt fokus på IT-säkerhet. På FRA har vi stark sekretess och det är viktigt att du känner dig bekväm med att hantera det.
   

  

**Du kan**
 För att lyckas och trivas i rollen har du kunskap och erfarenhet enligt följande:
   

  

* Högskoleutbildning med IT-inriktning alternativt förvärvat motsvarande kompetens genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Arbetat med utveckling och/eller systemadministration
* Goda kunskaper kring utvecklarstödverktyg och konfiguration av dessa
* Goda kunskaper kring versionshantering av kod och leverans
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift


 Vi ser det även som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av ett eller flera områden:
   

  

* Virtualisering tex Kubernetes
* Automatisering genom verktyg som tex Terraform och Ansible
* Objektorienterad programmering
* Air-gappade miljöer
* Utveckling av säkra system


**Du är**
 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som självständigt tar initiativ och kommer med nya idéer för hur man kan angripa nya utmaningar inom arbetet. Du följer självständigt utvecklingen av nya metoder och verktyg. Du har lätt för att anpassa dig till nya omständigheter och har en förmåga att arbeta konstruktivt även under mer pressade situationer. Du är bra på att samarbeta med andra snarare än att konkurrera, dela ansvar och hjälpa till på det sätt det behövs för att gruppen ska prestera. Som person söker du nya perspektiv och idéer för att stimulera innovation och förändring.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 På FRA är varje arbetsuppgift en del av något större. På ett eller annat sätt får du som medarbetare vara med och bidra till att skydda Sveriges integritet och oberoende i världen. Du är med och gör skillnad på riktigt, varje dag.
   

  

 Våra medarbetare har hög kompetens, men vi kan alltid bli bättre. Därför är professionell utveckling en självklarhet för oss. Vi erbjuder möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Som nyanställd får du bredda din kompetens direkt med en omfattande introduktionsutbildning som ger dig en större förståelse för uppdraget och hjälper dig in i verksamheten. Som medarbetare får du också möjlighet att hitta rätt utbildningar inom ditt specialområde för att bli ännu bättre på det du brinner för.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter god hälsa hos våra medarbetare och erbjuder bland annat friskvård under arbetstid. Andra förmåner som vi erbjuder är exempelvis gym på arbetsplatsen och ledarledda aktiviteter, gratis parkering, ledighet på klämdagar, utökad föräldrapenning samt natursköna omgivningar.
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en av de bästa. På ditt sätt.
   

  

**Mer information**
 Arbetsplatsen är belägen i närheten av Drottningholm, ca 10 min med buss från Brommaplan. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då anställning vid FRA innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för att få anställning är godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprövningen kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef på telefon 010-557 41 46 (tillgänglig fr.o.m. 7/1. Övrig tid hänvisas frågor till rekryteringra.se). Fackliga företrädare nås på 010-557 46 00.

title: Senior Solution Architect
description:
Are you an experienced Solution Architect who would enjoy leading the technical implementation team in the planning, elaboration, design, construction, and transition of PLM solutions that exceed customer requirements? Then you might be our new Solution Architect.
   

  

  

  

 Aras is unique in the PLM industry worldwide. With our business model and innovative platform, we are changing and revolutionizing an entire industry. Our advanced technology provides greater scalability, flexibility and security for the largest organizations worldwide. Airbus, Audi, Denso, General Motors (GM), Honda, Kawasaki Microsoft, Mitsubishi and Nissan, among others, are already using our software.
   

  

 As a Solution Architect at Aras, you have the overall ownership of the solution delivery. Demonstration of technical leadership, organization skills, and the ability to collaborate with key customer stakeholders and internal project managers are essential in ensuring success.
   

  

  

  

**Core Responsibilities**
* Lead a technical implementation team in all aspects of solution delivery
* Transform customer requirements into technical solutions by using thorough understanding of solution design and the Aras Innovator architecture and applications
* Facilitate workshops, develop solutions, build consensus across all stakeholders to ensure timely and successful delivery of technology aligned with business value
* Lead as well as support the development of requirements specifications, Use Cases, and functional specifications
* Perform solution analysis, develop customer facing proposals and contribute to the development of statements of work
* Facilitate and contribute to continuous improvement of how we deliver PLM solutions


  

  

**Your Profile Includes**
  

  

* Proven track record with enterprise software implementations in an Architect role, preferably within PLM
* Strong relationship building skills with both colleagues and external customers. Must be an effective communicator in difficult customer situations
* Highly organized and self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering (or equivalent experience)
* Experience in any of the following verticals: Automotive, Consumer Products, High Tech Electronics, Medical Devices, Aerospace, Defense, Shipbuilding
* Industry knowledge of any of the following: Engineering Design, Engineering Change Processes, Phase Gate Project Management, Quality Systems Processes, Manufacturing Process Planning, CMII Change Management, Systems Engineering, Requirements Engineering, Maintenance Design, Planning and Execution, Configuration Management, Variant Management
* Demonstrated experience with Agile project management tools such as Jira, Azure DevOps, etc.
* Ability to contribute to creating clear and understandable Requirements, SoW’s, Specification Documents and Use Cases
* Fluent in English and Swedish for communication in an international environment
* Swedish citizenship is required
* Willingness to travel.


  

  

 As you will be working in a mostly remote working organization, it is important that you are able to work independently but at the same time have a strong team spirit.
   

  

  

  

**What We Offer**
* Dynamic, open-minded & international team
* Development opportunities in a high growth environment
* Work remotely or in one of our modern offices
* Flexible working time models
* Extensive Onboarding
* Great team spirit and warm, inclusive work environment.

title: Vass systemutvecklare som vill göra skillnad sökes till Stockholm
description:
Välkommen till amaceit – där det är roligt, spännande och utmanande att arbeta som konsult och med hållbara lösningar för framtiden! 
 



  





  
 



 Till vårt växande kontor i Stockholm söker vi nu systemutvecklare som vill göra skillnad. På amaceit har vi inspirerande och passionerade individer som strävar efter att utveckla och skapa framtidens tekniska landskap. Om du letar efter ett arbete där du kan och vill göra skillnad men inte tumma på arbetsglädjen – bli en av oss! 
 



  





  
 



  





**Om rollen:** 
  
 



 Som systemutvecklare hos oss kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i tekniskt utmanande projekt. Ditt fokus ligger på fullstack, gärna med tyngdpunkt på frontend. Du kommer att arbeta med att implementera innovativa och hållbara lösningar med högsta kvalitet till våra kunder. Vi tror på att ge dig inflytande över dina uppdrag och strävar efter att skapa en arbetsmiljö som matchar både din tekniska kompetens och dina personliga mål -  med en balans mellan arbete och fritid.  
 



  





  
 



  





**Vad du kan få göra:** 
  
 



 Designa & utveckla .NET eller Java applikationer i frontend och backend. 
 



  





 Implementera och hantera molnbaserade lösningar i AWS och Azure. 
 



  





 Samarbeta med team för att definiera, designa och leverera nya funktioner. 
 



 Optimera programprestanda, skalbarhet och tillförlitlighet. 
 



  





 Delta i kodgranskningar för att upprätthålla höga standarder för kodkvalitet. 
 



  





   
 



**Bakgrund som vi gärna ser att du har:** 
  
 



  





 4+ års erfarenhet av Java eller .NET-utveckling. 
 



  





 Erfarenhet av att arbete med Azure och/eller AWS-tjänster. 
 



 Kunskaper i Docker och Kubernetes för att distribuera och hantera mikrotjänster. 
 



  





 Bra förståelse för ramverk. 
 



  





 Kunskaper om CI/CD-pipelines och DevOps-metoder.  
 



 Databaskunskap 
 



  





 Högskole eller universitetsutbildning 
 



  





  
 



**Vad vi erbjuder:** 
  
 



  





 Förutom en konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag och försäkringspaket kommer du att ingå i en inspirerande och positiv arbetsmiljö där gemenskap och drivkraft står i centrum. Hos oss får du inte bara tillgång till spännande projekt utan också möjlighet att vara en del av en kultur där vi värdesätter att ha roligt tillsammans! 
 



  





 Har du frågor, hör av dig till Mattias Kjörk på mattias.kjork@amaceit.se!

title: Data Governance Engineer, Solna or Copenhagen
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
We seek to strengthen our position and increase the speed of our digital transformation, and we are looking for you who will play an important role in identifying and implementing top notch data governance throughout the company. Analytics Center of Excellence is responsible for establishing the future IT landscape that will be the foundation for our data driven journey. PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics and as a part of the IT organization, we support a variety of different PostNord stakeholders in a multitude of areas using our Azure-based Data Platform as our base. It is our goal to create scalable solutions to support the development of valuable data solutions and address broad range of use cases from logistics operations, self-service reporting and advanced analytics for companywide innovation and transformation initiatives.
   

  

**Job Duties**
 As a Data Governance Engineer, you are the IT representative responsible for the governance and safeguarding of our valuable data assets. You'll be a part of our Analytics Centre of Excellence and the main stakeholder for governance tools and procedures, as well as representing data owners’ perspective on the data assets to the data architect and the different teams delivering the platform and analytics solutions.
   

  

 In this role, you'll have the opportunity to work on a wide range of projects and initiatives and get to know data and business representatives from all over the company. This is a new role at PostNord and your first task will be to set up structured processes and channels that ensure data ownership within the organization, by assigning and leading data stewards from the business side in working on prioritized data governance tasks.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Policy and Framework Implementation: Secure implementation, and maintenance of data governance policies, standards, and procedures. Establish and enforce data usage guidelines and ensure compliance with regulations.
* Data Quality Management: Create and monitor data quality metrics, including accuracy, completeness, and consistency. Collaborate with stakeholders to identify and resolve data quality issues.
* Metadata Management: Design, implement and maintain process framework to secure that relevant metadata is captured, stored and maintained in data dictionaries and catalogues. Ensure proper documentation of data sources, ownership, and lineage.
* Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure internal organizational compliance with data privacy and protection laws (e.g., GDPR). Identify and mitigate risks related to data security and integrity.
* Access Control and Security: Implement role-based access controls to secure sensitive data. Collaborate with IT and security teams to enforce data protection measures.
* Stakeholder Collaboration: Work with data stewards, business teams, and IT to define data ownership and accountability. Provide guidance and training on data governance best practices to stakeholders.
* Data Governance Tools and Technology: Develop strong expertise of the Microsoft Purview and drive its implementation on the enterprise level. Ensure that all available capabilities are utilized in the most effective way to satisfy PostNord requirements, for example automation of governance processes, such as data quality checks and reporting.
* Audit and Documentation: Maintain accurate records of data policies, governance processes, and system configurations.


 The tech stack still varies from team to team, but for data platform we are mainly focused on the Azure stack, (among the services used are Azure Auto ML, Azure ML Ops, Data Bricks, Data Factory, Synapse, Azure DevOps CI/CD, and Power BI etc). Our RPA team primarily work with UIPath and the Microsoft Power Platform. For governance, our preferred tool is Microsoft Purview.
   

  

 We prefer to use Agile, and our unit applies a pragmatic approach to SAFe to resolve dependencies and set the pace for development, but we choose the appropriate approach for the product and team.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You are either a technical person that thrives in the domain of processes and policies, or you have a background in organizational development but with a curiosity in data and analytics.
   

  

 It is important that you are comfortable to work closely with a multitude of stakeholders, ranging from tech geeks to strategy yuppies. You are result-oriented enough to not only identify what needs to be done within your area of responsibility, but also to be hands-on in executing the roadmap towards the target state.
   

  

**Requirements**
 We are seeking an individual with the potential for growth within the role. We don’t have a long list of specific requirements, but expect you to have:
   

  

* Proven track record of organizational development, project management, team leadership or similar experience in a context requiring change management
* Cloud literacy, and understanding of how modern IT solutions create business value
* Knowledge of, or curiosity in databases, data warehousing, big data platforms and data visualization tools


**Meriting**
* A relation to and clear opinion about agile philosophy and servant leadership
* Experience in data management or data governance


 We accept applications from all of EU but would require a remote colleague to be willing to work on site on a regular basis.
   

  

**We offer you**
* Work in a Nordic and dynamic environment.
* Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and health center.
* Employee benefits through PostNord’s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus.
* Great occupational pension terms.
* Great development opportunities and a continuous learning culture.
* Employment in Stockholm or Copenhagen.


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis. If you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact Pernille Skovborg on pernille.skovborg@postnord.com.
   

  

 We are looking forward to hear from you!
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga

title: Concept Manager
description:
Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Här är din chans, då vi just nu söker vi dig som vill arbeta som Concept Manager hos oss på Atea i Göteborg, Malmö eller Stockholm.



Som Concept Manager på Atea inom Hybrid Platforms får du möjligheten att arbeta med ett kompetent team och bidra med förstklassiga affärslösningar till våra kunder på deras digitala utvecklingsresa. Ta chansen att bli en del av vårt team och bidra till vår gemensamma framgång!


**Din roll på Atea**
--------------------



Vi behöver just nu förstärkning inom fokusområdet Modern Applications och jag söker därför dig som har en grundkunskap kring datacenter-lösningar och kompetens inom AI, automation och Cloud Native.



Din vardag i rollen som Concept Manager, kommer att innebära ett nära samarbete med vår specialistsäljarkår inom Hybrid Platforms för att utveckla innovativa tjänster och lösningar som stödjer våra kunder i resan mot en modern och hållbar infrastruktur. Teamet du kommer att jobba i består idag av sex individer med olika ansvarsområden.



Du kommer ansvara för att etablera och utveckla erbjudanden och lösningsaffären inom ditt fokusområde i syftet att stärka Ateas ledande roll inom områdena AI och infrastruktur. Du får i denna roll agera evangelist för nya teknologier och visar på affärsnyttan av att modernisera våra kunders IT-miljö.



Vidare kommer du även ansvara för förvaltning och utveckling av befintliga erbjudanden och kommer att besöka våra kunder för att hjälpa dem hitta rätt lösningar, passar deras verksamhet. Därmed förväntas du lätt kunna bryta ner övergripande mål och skapa planer för att stödja kundernas transformationsresa och skapa nyckelinitiativ.


**Vad vi söker hos dig**
------------------------



För att lyckas i denna roll söker vi dig som har ett proaktivt förhållningssätt och förmågan att självständigt strukturera och planera ditt arbete. Du är kommunikativ och pedagogisk, och trivs med att hålla presentationer på olika events, både internt och externt.


**För tjänsten som Concept Manager har du:**


* Erfarenhet av cloud native och AI lösningar
* Erfarenhet av automationslösningar
* Erfarenhet av datacenterlösningar
* Erfarenhet från en liknande roll
* Erfarenhet av försäljning
* Tidigare erfarenhet av en roll med kundansvar
* Obehindrar i svenska i tal och skrift samt goda kunskaper i engelska i tal och skrift


**Meriterande:**


* Erfarenhet av IT konsult branschen


Detta är ett fartfyllt och spännande uppdrag inom erbjudande. Vi erbjuder en utvecklande och fri roll där du får utlopp för din nyfikenhet och ditt intresse för de senaste teknologiska trenderna.


**Vårt löfte till dig**
-----------------------



Hos oss får du vara med att bidra till ett smartare, effektivare och mer hållbart samhälle. Med fokus på utveckling, laganda och personligt ansvarstagande ser vi till att göra skillnad. Vi uppmuntrar och stöttar varandra, och tar vara på våra individuella förmågor, perspektiv och erfarenheter. Det är därför du är viktig för oss. För att du är du, för att du är nyfiken och för att du vill växa professionellt – och som människa. Tillsammans skapar vi laget som bygger Sverige med it.


**Kontakt & mer information**
-----------------------------



Med anledning av kommande semesterperiod kan återkoppling på din ansökan dröja något längre än vanligt. Men ansök redan idag då vi genomför löpande urval!  

  

Vid eventuella frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta, Nina Karlsson, Affärsområdeschef Hybrid Platforms, via nina.karlsson@atea.se.  

  

Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, för att få en bättre bild av dig som vår framtida medarbetare.  

  

Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.

  

  

***Vi hoppas på att få se din ansökan!***

  


**Följ oss i sociala medier**

  

#LI-REMOTE


Ansök nu
  
Dela denna sida
Stad
Sverige,Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö
Sista ansökan
2025-01-21
Ansök nu

title: Global Account Director - Nordics
description:
Change your job, change your workplace, change your future...


**We are actively building diverse teams and welcome applications from everyone**



Role: Global Account Director - Nordics  

Located: Solna, Sweden (Hybrid working)  

Package: Competitive salary, bonus and company benefits

  



(Ricoh operate a vibrant working policy giving you flexible hybrid working options)

  

**About Ricoh:**



Ricoh is a global technology business. As a company born in print, we design and manufacture graphic solutions that transform communications. To keep up with the pace of change in the workplace, we have built an extensive portfolio of innovative, industry-leading digital services spanning everything from Cloud & IT infrastructure solutions to process automation tools.



Everything we do is designed to help individuals achieve fulfilment through work. Through technology, we make work smarter and more creative. Enabling people to lead purposeful working lives and organisations to become more productive, sustainable and profitable.


What you will be doing


As the Global Account Director you will provide strategic account leadership on designated Global Major Accounts to achieve profitable growth for Ricoh and our customers.



Responsible for winning, growing, and maintaining total business globally to achieve both customer and Ricoh Family Group objectives.


* Achieve financial targets in line with defined priority areas such as global revenue, profitability and new services wins
* Own senior customer relationships and be accountable to senior internal Ricoh stakeholders for account performance
* Responsible for total customer business on global basis including hardware, software, services, and annuity
* Formulate and execute global account planning that provides clear vision, objectives, and strategy
* Identify and win new opportunities on a local, regional, and global basis across all Ricoh business areas
* Matrix management across the Ricoh Family Group to ensure virtual teams and resources are aligned in achieving customer objectives
* Deep understanding of the customer landscape including organisational priorities, industry challenges and decision-making process

  


Key Performance Measures

  

**Develop and Implement a Global Account Plan**

* Situational analysis of customer’s business and opportunity bridge to Ricoh strategy and offerings
* Framework for specific account priorities and actions, including activity within each stage of sales cycle
* Clear approach to meet or exceed financial and non-financial targets, including identifying gaps and taking corrective action
* Grow wallet share in strategic new business areas for Ricoh with a particular focus on priority services through co-creation and strategic roadmap activities

  


**Develop and Maintain Global Customer Relationships**

* Build strong senior stakeholder and operational network within the customer’s organization aligning to Ricoh
* Identify, develop, and maintain strong relationships within customer team / i.e. Coach, Influencer, Decision Maker, Executive
* Develop a deep understanding of the customer business and industry / vertical market. Bring thought leadership, share insights, and challenge the customer’s thinking to inspire action
* Understand the customer’s investment and decision-making process

  


**Manage Global Account Satisfaction and Loyalty**

* Accountable for the operational aspects and contractual commitments towards the customer
* Act quickly to ensure operational issues are resolved in a timely manner negating customer escalation
* Create long term commitment through joint business planning and customer engagement
* Turn customers into advocates to support wider Ricoh business, measured through Customer Satisfaction Index

  


**Build and Lead the Global Account Team**

* Motivate and inspire a global team including RGS, Region and Operating Company: sales, technical, and service delivery in line with Global Team Selling approach
* Sales leadership to the Operating Company and Lines of Business teams via a matrix reporting line
* Provide timely and accurate management information for business forecasting and budgeting
* Accountable for global revenues in order of magnitude of $20m per annum


You will ideally have


* Bachelor degree or equivalent required
* Master's Degree such as Executive MBA is desirable
* Fluent in English and local language of designated Global Major Accounts. Additional language(s) beneficial but not required.
* Experienced in global business transactions: knowledge around legal, regulatory, commercial and operational considerations in global business
* General knowledge and appreciation of key technology trends impacting upon customers
* IT literate for Microsoft Office and other business applications
* Travelled and/or lived in other countries and an appreciation of different cultures
* Flexibility in working across global time zones
* 10+ years Global Account Management experience
* 5+ years consultative selling experience
* Proven track record and/or experience in Strategic Acct Selling to Fortune Global 500 companies
* Comfortable operating in highly complex and rapidly changing environments
* Experienced working in cross-functional teams with leaders of other business units and vendors

  


FUNCTION### **Sales and Consulting**

LOCATION### **Sweden**

CONTRACT TYPE### **Permanent**

CLOSING DATE### **20-Jan-2025**

title: IFS Cloud Consultant
description:
There is never a typical day at Accenture, but that’s why we love it here! You now have the opportunity to build a rewarding career as an IFS Cloud Technical Consultant/Architect at Accenture Technology . If you’re looking for a challenging career working in a vibrant environment with access to training, cutting edge technology and a global network of experts, this could be the role for you.

  

We will give you the opportunity to grow personally and professionally in a dynamic environment. Our projects are built on cooperation and teamwork and you will find yourself working together with other talented, passionate and dedicated consultants towards a shared goal. We are working in international teams, where you will work with colleagues from other offices and offshore delivery centers.

 **Work you will do as a IFS Technical Cloud Consultant/Architect**  

* As an IFS Technical Consultant, you will work closely with our clients to design, configure, and implement IFS ERP solutions
* You will leverage your technical expertise to configure & customize IFS applications, ensure smooth integrations with other systems, and provide ongoing support and optimization
* Advise clients on best practices for IFS setup, configuration, and optimization. Troubleshoot and resolve any technical issues that arise
* As an IFS Cloud Technical consultant professional, you are likely to be responsible for leading technical design and developing cutting edge technology solutions
* You will use your skills working with IFS Cloud and using the latest technologies in the most interesting and most demanding projects – where your contribution will make a difference to the customer!
* Solve complex client problems by working in multinational teams on client-facing projects
* Work with tasks such as creating business cases, proposal development and presentations to client stakeholders
* Be part of high performing teams, learning from and supporting each other develop every day
* Engage in internal Accenture initiatives of your choice, such as recruiting and community activities

  

**Who we are looking for**  

* Completed a Bachelor’s or Master's degree
* Overall at least 5 years of professional IFS experience
* Proven experience as an IFS Technical Consultant or in a similar ERP technical role (preferably with IFS Applications 10+)
* Strong knowledge of IFS technical architecture, including IFS middleware, and web services
* Experience with IFS development tools (e.g., IFS Development Studio, IFS Apps 10+)
* Understanding of how IFS supports business processes
* Expertise in system integration, data migration, and customizations within IFS
* Proficient in SQL, PL/SQL, and other relevant programming languages. Nice to have knowledge on Business Process Automation
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues efficiently
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience in investigating and solving performance issues. Ability to work independently and support the team as a technical lead
* Strong supervisory and coaching skills
* Ability to be flexible and work analytically in a problem-solving environment
* Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies
* Passionate about innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients
 **Locations**  

We are looking for a candidate to join our office in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Malmö. Mobility and flexibility to either work physically at an office (client or Accenture), or in a virtual “home office” is expected. This requires you to both have a high degree of flexibility for travelling to our clients or working with international teams virtually.


We look forward to receiving your application!
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: Senior Enterprise Account Manager
description:
External Description:
**Build Your Career at Informatica**
------------------------------------


We're looking for a diverse group of collaborators who believe data has the power to improve society. Adventurous, work-from-anywhere minds who value solving some of the world's most challenging problems. Here, employees are encouraged to push their boldest ideas forward, united by a passion to create a world where data improves the quality of life for people and businesses everywhere.


**Senior Enterprise Account Manager, Nordics (Stockholm based)**
----------------------------------------------------------------


**Informatica** is looking for a **Senior Enterprise Account Manager** with experience selling Enterprise business software to join our team in Stockholm, Sweden**.**


You will report to the **Senior Regional Sales Director**


The Account Manager will sell our strategic enterprise software Data solutions and driving incremental subscription & cloud revenue. In the role of Territory Account Manager, you will maintain relationships within assigned accounts and maximize Informatica's footprint within them. We are looking for knowledge of complex organizational challenges and being able to translate these into Data Solutions that drive agreed outcomes. Your character is based on tenacity, grid, perseverance and a will to drive our customers' success.


**Your Role Responsibilities? Here's What You'll Do**
-----------------------------------------------------


* You are responsible for the execution plan of each assigned account.
* Develop a strategic and comprehensive business plan for your accounts, including identifying core customer requirements and mapping the benefits of Informatica's solutions to customer requirements and agreed outcomes.
* Sell-to and work with executive-level customer decision-makers up to and including the CXO level.
* Accountable for accurate forecasting in SFDC, qualifying against our MEDDICC methodology, regular quarterly revenue delivery and the implementation of agreed account and business plans.
* Developing your own pipeline for the shorter and longer-term requires taking ownership to create new opportunities yourself and to maximize this you work with our Strategic Partners and Marketing to develop an plan for the accounts, to include events, seminars, and roadmap sessions.

**What We'd Like to See**
-------------------------


* 5+ years of experience in a Field Sales role and selling Enterprise Software solutions.
* Relevant Bachelors or Master's degree.
* Industry knowledge of Business Services Accounts.

**Role Essentials**
-------------------


* Experience hitting sales targets.
* Deep industry knowledge of a customer's decision-making process, goals, strategies, and goals.
* In-depth understanding of the power of Data and its impact on data-driven decisions.
* BA/BS or equivalent educational background, we will consider an equivalent combination of relevant education and experience
* Minimum 5+ years of relevant professional experience

**Perks & Benefits**
--------------------


* Comprehensive health, vision, and wellness benefits (Paid parental leave, adoption benefits, life insurance, disability insurance and 401k plan or international pension/retirement plans
* Flexible time-off policy and hybrid working practices
* Tuition reimbursement program to support your and personal growth
* Equity opportunities and an employee stock purchase program (ESPP)
* Comprehensive Mental Health and Employee Assistance Program (EAP) benefit

We're guided by our DATA values and we are passionate about building and delivering solutions that accelerate data innovations. At Informatica, we know diversity drives innovation. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer dedicated to maintaining a work environment free from discrimination, one where all employees are treated with dignity.


Informatica (NYSE: INFA), an Enterprise Cloud Data Management leader, brings data to life by empowering businesses to realize the transformative power of their most critical assets. We have pioneered the Informatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud™ (IDMC) that manages data across any multi-cloud, hybrid system, democratizing data to advance business strategies. Customers in over 100 countries and 85 of the Fortune 100 rely on Informatica. www.informatica.com. Connect with LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook. **Informatica. Where data comes to life.**
company_description: Informatica, the Enterprise Cloud Data Management leader, empowers businesses to realize the transformative power of data.

title: Account Director Enterprise - Nordics
description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company, directly powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences that truly revolve around their customers - no matter the channels they use. More than 150,000 businesses - including many of the world's largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
  
We dream big - for our company, our customers and our employees - and we hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. We have near 4,500 Sinchers in more than 60 countries - probably somewhere near you!
  
  

We are seeking an experienced Account Director Enterprise for our Nordics region, who will be responsible for managing all aspects of the end-to-end customer lifecycle in the region, and as such, you will be strategic and possess an outstanding knowledge of customer-centric operating models.
  
This role is based at our Stockholm office, Sweden, and reports to our Director Northern Europe Enterprise.
  
  

**The essence of the role :**  

As Account Director Enterprise for our Nordics region, you will be a manager leading a highly motivated and talented account management team AND managing some of the region’s top accounts with a view to achieving the next level of growth both in the accounts and the region.
  
  

**As our new Account Director, you will:**  

* Duo responsibility of delivering the P&L – revenue, gross margin, gross profit, and controllable operating expenditure for the region PLUS leading a select set of accounts ensuring high satisfaction, profitability, and growth
* Help build and drive a go-to-market strategy in alignment with global motions to win and retain business, setting goals for team, manage and directing staff to be successful.
* Actively identify business opportunities with current and prospective customers, while collaborating with our New Sales team to help drive the new sales motion.
* Maintaining relationships with larger clients by providing information, support, and guidance to ensure Sinch becomes their trusted advisor.
* Responsible for managing your business OPEX (ex. Sales, salaries, commissions, marketing, travel, and expenses) within the allocated budget.
* Work closely with the other Account Directors, Director of Northern Europe and Enterprise Sales Director to deliver profitable growth and top tier customer experience.
* Monitor customer, market and competitor activity and provide feedback to company leadership and other company functions.
* Participate and represent Sinch at relevant industry and network events.
* Create a culture of success and managing ongoing business and goal achievements.
* Actively manage, develop, and lead the team, both in terms of performance, enablement, and engagement.


**Who are you?:**  

We’re looking for a person with a strong commercial mindset blended with a passion for people, culture and brand, essential ingredients to lead our regional team.
  
  

**In order to be successful in this role, we believe you have:**  

* Experience in the communications industry and/or PaaS highly regarded.
* Regional market experience with a strong network
* Strong history in commercial leadership and meeting sales goals
* Leadership skills and experience in managing and interacting with multicultural sales teams across a wide geographic area.
* Client relationship skills
* Negotiations and closing skills.
* Self-driven and the ability to work autonomously.
* Excellent communication skills, fluency in English.
* You will stand out in the crowd if you have knowledge of Adobe campaign and Salesforce marketing cloud ecosystem.


Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in English.
  
  

Are you ready? Join us on our journey!
  
  

About The Recruitment Process
  
To help us place the right people in the right role, we believe in science-based and fair assessment methods. We follow a competence-based, structured interview process where your skills, experience, and attributes relevant to the role and Sinch will be assessed. As part of our recruitment process, pre-employment testing is used to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role. We acknowledge that there are two parties deciding in this process and welcome you to ask any questions you may have at any stage of the process.
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.
